sense.name: a cause or agent of danger, a hazard
sense.commentary: PERIL[+cause][+effective][+danger] [+relation][+role][+agent][+danger] Note: 'peril' occurs as object/subject, not in a prepositional phrase Note: refers to something that is the source, cause of danger
sense.examples: Many studies have concluded that smoking is a peril to your health. She first experienced the perils of stardom a decade ago. The recent assassination poses a peril to future negotiations.

sense.name: being in a state of exposure to danger
sense.commentary: PERIL[+state][+exposure][+danger] Note: 'peril' occurs with preposition, 'at peril' 'in peril' Note: refers to a potential dangerous state of something/someone
sense.examples: Swim on that beach at your own peril. This political movement is in peril of dying. The weak dam has put the city in peril of a flood.
